channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tesla is looking to hire 800 new employees 3 months after Elon Musk ordered mass firings of thousands
item.description: The roles have steadily popped up on Tesla’s careers page in recent weeks, with positions spanning artificial intelligence specialists to more run-of-the-mill service jobs.

item.title: Morgan Stanley to report second-quarter earnings
item.description: Morgan Stanley is likely to benefit from its Wall Street-centric business model.

item.title: Pro-Trump super PAC reportedly has Elon Musk’s support after raising millions
Dublin residents are standing up to $2.3 trillion neighbor Google’s plans to build a pub, saying they are ‘effectively living’ on the tech giant’s campus
item.description: Locals living next to Google's Dublin campus say they will be subjected to public urination if the tech giant is allowed to build a pub.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens
item.description: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

item.title: SALT tax deduction: Here’s why red-wave election could threaten taxpayer relief
Uber is betting millions on a startup hoping to solve the biggest roadblock facing electric vehicles
item.description: The ride-share giant is helping fund a startup to make EV charging as easy for renters as for homeowners

item.title: Bank of America tops estimates on better-than-expected investment banking
item.description: CEO Brian Moynihan told investors in April that net interest income would bottom in the second quarter.

item.title: Inflation is cooling. Why that’s not a headwind for corporate earnings.
Trump’s new VP pick JD Vance brands China the ‘biggest threat’ to the U.S.: ‘We are completely distracted from it’
item.description: JD Vance called China the "biggest threat" in an interview with Fox News shortly after his nomination.

item.title: Gareth Southgate steps down as manager of England's soccer team
item.description: The news comes two days after England's Euro 2024 final defeat to Spain.

item.title: Bitcoin now considered ‘legitimate’ by Larry Fink of BlackRock
Nokia CEO: Europe shouldn’t be afraid to back its innovation champions
item.description: While Europe is still home to world-leading companies, the European Union has fallen behind both the U.S. and China in key technologies.

item.title: Uber now shows average wait time and cost for rides in thousands of cities
item.description: The feature, which aims to make planning summer travel easier, comes as record numbers of travelers are passing through U.S. airports.

item.title: Dow industrials close at record level for first time since May — live coverage
